questions.question_text: Which mobile app can users leverage to create assets, perform inventory audits, and receive assets?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Page 390 HAMF Vancouver

Selected Answer: A
Now Agent Mobile App

Selected Answer: A
Now Agent Mobile App

choices.E: A normalization rule for the hardware model does not exist in the Content Service
choices.D: You have opted out of the ServiceNow Content Service
choices.C: Your hardware model form contains a good model number, but a badly formatted model name
choices.A: The hardware model content has not yet been downloaded from the Content Service
choices.B: Normalization could not match any of the three key fields in the hardware model form with a rule in the Content Service

discussion.content:
"The normalization process could not match any of the three key fields of the hardware/consumable model with a rule in the Hardware Library (== THIS IS B ==). In this case, all of the key fields are editable and once the information is added, the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized. 

Match Not Found status could occur if a normalization rule for the hardware does not exist (== THIS IS E ==). For example, if the organization created custom hardware specific to their organization. These are the items that are sent to the ServiceNow Content Service team for review when you opt-in to that process."
=> From above, B + E are correct, 
=> Between A,C,D, I would choose A. So A,B,E are correct.

Selected Answer: ABE
Match Not Found
â€“
The normalization process could not match any of the three key fields of the hardware/consumable model with a rule in the Hardware Library. In this case, all of the key fields are editable and once the information is added, the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized. 

Match Not Found status could occur if a normalization rule for the hardware does not exist. For example, if the organization created custom hardware specific to their organization. These are the items that are sent to the ServiceNow Content Service team for review when you opt-in to that process.

Selected Answer: ABE
C is not an answer because as long as model number is accurate, if name is badly formatted, it still keeps the name as it is but it still successfully normalizes. 

D is not correct because when you opt-out, you just stop sending the data to SNOW but you still receive the data and normalisation still works.

Selected Answer: ABE
From page 119 of HAMF Vancouver text:

Match Not Found: The normalization process could not match any of the three key fields or that hardware/consumable model with a rule in the Hardware Library. In this case, all the key fields are editable and once you add the information, the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized.

Note: The 'Match Not Found' status could occur if a normalization rule for the hardware does not exist. For example, if the organization created custom hardware specific to their organization. These are the items that are sent to the ServiceNow Content Service team for review when you opt into that process.

Selected Answer: ACE
ACE from NowLearning: 
Not Normalized includes 'Match not found' which means something is either badly formatted, or the content is not yet available from the Content Service (either not downloaded or simply not available).

Selected Answer: ACD
Not Normalized includes 'Match not found' which means something is either
badly formatted, or the content is not yet available from the Content Service
(either not downloaded or simply not available).

questions.question_text: Several of your models are listed as Match Not Found on the Model Management tab of the Hardware Asset dashboard. What are the potential causes of this? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Track its monetary value or costs
choices.E: Know its relationships to other assets in the CMDB
choices.D: Manage its associated license, warranty, or lease contracts
choices.A: Manage its procurement, maintenance, or retirement

questions.question_text: A component is considered an IT asset vs. a configuration item (CI) when you want to do which of the following? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: ACD is good one

Selected Answer: ACD
What you want to track for an Asset:
Financial information
Contractual information
Lifecycle details and relationships

Selected Answer: ACD
From page 145 of the Vancouver HAM text:

Asset:
1. Financial information
2. Contractual information
3. Lifecycle details and relationships

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD is answer

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD are correct

Selected Answer: ACD
Don't listen to Satyam and Vijaya answers. CI tracks OPERATIONAL AND RELATIONSHIP stuff

Selected Answer: ACD
IT Asset: Hardware, software, and data that needs to be financially tracked
CI: An component that may or may not be an asset; managed from an operational perspective

ade is corr
ect ans of new verion of utah
BDE is the actual answer

questions.question_text: What original costs are involved in purchasing an asset and putting it into use? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
Page 452 Vancouver

Selected Answer: ABE
ABE from NowLearning
Original costs are the dollars involved in purchasing an asset and putting it into use, such as:

Purchase price or lease cost
Taxes paid at time of purchase or while in stock waiting to be put in use
Delivery costs
Storage costs
Installation costs
Warranty costs

Selected Answer: ABE
Answer is A,B, E

questions.question_text: A scheduled job runs nightly to determine if any rate cards need to be applied to generate expense lines. What is the name of the scheduled job?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Process FM Costs

Explanation: "The scheduled job, Process FM Costs, runs on the Contract [ast_contract] table once per day. Expense lines are only generated from contracts with the Active or Expired state. You may want to generate expense lines for expired contracts to track previous expenses."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/contract-management/task/t_Step3ConfigRCExpenseGen.html

Selected Answer: C
C
Expense lines are automatically generated by a scheduled job for costs incurred between the rate card Start date and End date. The scheduled job, Process FM Costs, runs on the Contract [ast_contract] table once per day. Expense lines are only generated from contracts with the Active or Expired state. You may want to generate expense lines for expired contracts to track previous expenses.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/contract-management/task/t_Step3ConfigRCExpenseGen.html

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
